title: Frutiger condensed italic
content: Does this font exist from any foundry? I’m a production manager at an agency where naughty young designers have specified Frutiger condensed as part of a corporate identity, and now we’re fudging when we need Frutiger condensed italic. Is there another font that would pass for Frutiger cond ital?
author: allenhanford

comments.content:
Give Myriad Pro Condensed Italic a try. Myriad is also called the better Frutiger. - Frutiger itself dont loved the idea of a true italic, but the market demanded, so Linotype made it. Have a look to Linotypes Frutiger Next. They used the italic model of Myriad for their version, but not for the condensed ones.

— [astype.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20090419081156/http:/www.astype.de/)—

FF Transit Italic might work...

[http://www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&searchby=manufact...](http://web.archive.org/web/20090419081156/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FF.11003.11.16 "http://www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FF.11003.11.16")

Also Corpid might be worth a look, not sure if a condensed italic exists - [http://www.lucasfonts.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090419081156/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/ "http://www.lucasfonts.com/")

Si

You may also want to look at Adobe Myriad MM Condensed Italic if you have it. They have it in a selection of different weights.

gln
